metadata.synopsis: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
metadata.how_to_trigger: Pick up or equip S_UND_MonkAmulet_Amulet_de2ea5a9-943a-4794-9ef7-208be7747178To trigger GREETING1. Enter the game as any character and 'loadlevel WLD_Main_A' into recon.2. goto -626.25, -4.53, 223.75.3. create OBJ_Scroll_Knock 10 and cast knock on the locked chest.4. Equip the amulet

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: Thou shalt return me, ho HO. Thou shalt have my blessing.

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Flying machines. Walking brains. It's all so absurd!*

7.speaker: Player
7.text: What is happening? What are you doing to me?

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *The urge to laugh intensifies. Talking jewellery? That's hilarious!*

27.text: Do not abandon my blessing - hee hee!

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *You stifle a chuckle and drop the amulet. The urge to laugh passes...*
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stifles their laughter and drops the amulet. The spirit disappears.InternalNodeContext: Player takes 1 fire damage.

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *The laugh-urge fades. A quiet power spreads from hand to head, then down to your feet.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *There is no escaping the laughter. Telepathic mushrooms? Walking brains? It's all so comical!*

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Ha. Ha ha. Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha hee!
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player breaks out in uncontrollable laughter as Tasha's Hideous Laughter is cast on them. Eventually, it dissipates, leaving the player briefly clutching their stomach in pain before returning to their default state.NodeContext: Uncontrollable laughter, on the brink of madness.

68.text: How unfortunate. Alas, thou must do. Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee!

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Squash all cheer and summon memories of your ancestral enemy - the mind flayers.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *Images of illithids torturing and tormenting your people quells the urge to laugh - for now.*

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Quiet your mind. Let everything be still.

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *You observe the urge to laugh from afar, letting it fade with each breath.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *Sheer, unbridled rage floods your veins, obliterating the urge to laugh.*

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Whisper a prayer. Quell the feeling with your devotion.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Summon your light and devotion as you push back.

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *Your faith and dedication surrounds you, forming an impenetrable shield.*

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*

63.text: Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?

91.text: Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!

111.text: Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

16.text: To my granddaughter. Shirra Clarwen. Serves Ilmater, she doth.

107.text: She waits in Wyrm's Crossing. Take me there, and thou shalt bathe in her golden gifts.

53.text: O! Thou shalt be blessed indeed. He he hee!

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Are you a ghost? What happened to you?

84.text: A ghost? Ha HA! I am sunlight on water, dew on grass.

40.text: Sharrans broke my body. But my spirit, they could not. Well - not completely. Hee HEE!

94.text: Thou shalt return me home. It is written!

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: That thing's tainted. Better to leave it than bear a dead man's grudges.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: That laughter. What did you do to me?

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I could barely hold my laughter. What did you do to me?

37.text: The Sharrans tormented me. And I laughed at the pain 'til ne'er couldst I stop.

74.text: Is there affliction more terrible than eternal joy? This is my pleasure. This is my curse.

3.text: Ha. Haha. Ha ha ha HA HA HA HAAAAAA!

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I will take you to your granddaughter at Wyrm's Crossing.

96.text: I shall walk with thee. I shall grant you my power. He HEE.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I've found Wyrm's Crossing. Where is your granddaughter?

104.text: Shirra hath devoted her body and soul to Ilmater. Find her at the Open Hand Temple!

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'm afraid your granddaughter has passed away.

12.text: Oh ho ho HO NO NO!

109.text: This cannot, must not, shall not be - he HEE. You must open her tomb in the Open Hand Temple, posthaste. She may bless us, even beyond the veil!

59.text: Done, it shalt be! Ho HO!

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *You feel a chuckle coming on - but it soon fades.*
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spirit fades away, player pockets amulet.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Etched on its face is an image of the dawning sun.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Lines and arcs are etched into the metal, but you see no pattern in them.*

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Contemplate the symbol of Lathander in your hand.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Contemplate the symbol of Lathander in your hand.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Consider the inscribed image. What could it mean?

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *You recognise the symbol: it belongs to those sworn to Lathander, god of dawn and renewal.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Whatever madness this spirit suffers was inflicted by Lathander's enemies - followers of Shar. And this madness may flow into you.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *The image is striking, but you find no meaning in it.*

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Focus on this entity. What are its intentions?

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Beneath the rampant joy, you sense the monk's fear and sincerity. He doesn't wish to harm you - but that doesn't mean he won't.*

106.text: Prithee, now is not the time for dreaming! Open thine eyes, fair fool!

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Close your eyes and let your magic flow through you in all its wild and beautiful glory.

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *Your pure, raw power rips through the urge to laugh.*

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Call on the power of your pact and resist the urge.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Your power spikes, banishing the urge to laugh in an instant.*

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Reach for the Weave. Let it shield you from this impulse.

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *The urge flows into the strands of the Weave, leaving only a sense of calm.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: Ha ha, hast thou missed me? Take me to my dear Shirra and open her tomb!

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Laughter builds, deep in your chest. It is... irresistible.*
